author: William Fiuza

text: Warcraft 2 was such a cool game. They made so many improvements over the original. The game play was fun, the story engrossing, the music top notch, and the expansion was  good too. Even the port to the PSOne was really  fun. Blizzard really needs to get back to its old self again.
author: David Alvarez

text: Indeed, I played for the first time both 1 and 2 a one year ago and Warcraft 1 was fun but all game mechanics was so stupid like one town hall only and poor AI response of your units not even trying to fight back without a command.
author: Bartosz Skorupa

text: Yeah, it was pretty frustrating to play, especially on the the harder missions. But the idea was so cool, and the potential was definitely there. Warcraft 2 delivered in spades.
author: David Alvarez

text: @David Alvarez True. Also high resource requirements on everything slowing the game a lot, 4 character limit per group and fact that to move or attack you need to press a keyboard button. Glad that Warcraft 2 Battle net edition fixed most of problems that Warcraft 1 have.

author: DarkJenko

text:
I think if they picked up Warcraft 4, the most likely event would be to take "sidestories" of the series.

Why? Because it can tie back into WoW for one without needing to test the limits of their storytelling, while also allowing them to expand on the world with newer casts that aren't, well, just the leaders of the Alliance and the Horde.

Dealing with stray sentient undead would for example be quite compelling imo.
author: Sveinung Tørresdal

author: DTMTroy

text: The WoW story didn't really screw much up, since each end boss was still killed by a Hero from Warcraft lore (Akama, Kalec, Thrall, and so on) who were followed by a band of intrepid mercenaries (you, the players). This isn't really any different to Warcraft, where you simply recruit faceless men and women to do your bidding. With a bit of ingenuity and competency in the craft, I'm sure a potential 4th entry could pick things up just fine.

author: wiegraf9009

text:
There won't be a Warcraft IV. They have an RTS already, which is Starcraft II. Warcraft's world continues in WoW. Only when WoW dies, and it will take a VERY long time for it to kick the bucket, will we get the chance.

Until then, nope. Forget it.

What they CAN do... and SHOULD do imho... is to make a TPS adventure game spinoff. It's not a genre they've touched yet...

author: Rusty

text: Warcarft 4 should be made within the next 3 years or it will experience Duke Nukem Syndrome. A horrible condition in which Fan Expectations will never meet the cold hard reality that the developers are fine and dandy just coasting on money made from previous installments, and as soon as they can see their floor past the piles of cash they will make a quick, hack of a sequel to fill in the missing pieces.
author: Rusty

text: I remember when we thought 7 years between Warcraft II and Warcraft III was an incredibly long wait... Well it's been 11 years since Warcraft III came out (I feel old). Where's our Warcraft IV, Blizzard? It's not like WoW is needing all of your time and ressources anymore. Hopefully, it's going to be their next big announcement.
